summary: This document is an email chain from July 16, 2020, regarding unsolicited communications about alleged video footage of extremists/traffickers in Wisconsin connected to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails show a U.S. Attorney's Office recipient dismissing the sender as 'a little off' and referring the matter to someone who handles such individuals.

persons.name: Jose Leon
persons.context: Sent the initial email with links to alleged video footage concerning extremists/traffickers in Wisconsin connected to Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the email subject as being connected to the alleged video footage and trafficking activities.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named in the email subject as being connected to the alleged video footage and trafficking activities.

connections.description: Both are named together in the email subject as being connected to the alleged trafficking activities and video footage.

events.title: Email about alleged Epstein/Maxwell video footage
events.description: Jose Leon sends an email with links to alleged video footage of extremists/traffickers in Wisconsin connected to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations.context: Mentioned as the location where alleged video footage of extremists/traffickers connected to Epstein and Maxwell was captured.

keyFacts: An individual named Jose Leon contacted a U.S. Attorney's Office in July 2020 with claims about video footage of extremists/traffickers in Wisconsin linked to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email recipient within the U.S. Attorney's Office characterized Jose Leon as 'a little off' and indicated they would pass the matter to someone who handles such individuals.
The document shows unsolicited tips and allegations about the Epstein case were being directed to law enforcement as late as 2020.
